summary: The Students Helping Young Students Act of 2025 amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to establish a work-study program for college students to provide community service at after-school activities. The bill defines "after-school activities," outlines guidelines for fund usage, specifies a registration process for eligible schools, and sets standards for participation, with a priority for schools serving low-income communities. It also provides a federal share for compensation, potentially exceeding 75%.
